## Conservation & rarity context

-   IUCN: Least Concern
-   **Rarity note:** Species of gall wasp that forms galls on Quercus virginia and rarely Q. geminata.

## Natural history notes

Tan, smooth, globular galls on under side of oak leaves in high numbers in the fall. This species is replaced by B. kinseyi north and west of Mississippi. Adults emerge is the middle of spring, corresponding with the timing of leaf flush in these oak species. This species undergoes both an asexual and a sexual generation.
